_header: If lust or anger do thy mind assail
_description: A single couplet in the hand of Thomas Lower

BLRoy9Cii.Transcription:
Yf luste or anger do Thy mynde assayleSubdu occsyon & thou
                    shallte sone prevayle
BLRoy9Cii.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.363.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: xxxii.
